name: Zeigler House Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just came back from a stay at Zeigler House Inn and highly recommend it. I list it as one of 'THE BEST' B&B's we have stayed at. Jackie goes out of her way to make sure your visit is the best. She is there to assist you with any information you need and has good recommendations for restaurants, whether you're looking for where the locals like to go or want a touristy place. She goes a big extra yard to make your stay comfortable with fresh flowers throughout the room, candies, a stocked refrigerator with juice, water, soft drinks, yogurt and english muffins. The fresh pastries she brings on a daily basis are very good. The private porch is so nice and even if it rains, as it did when we were there, you can still sit outside because it is covered. It is very clean and she even goes as far as supplying decent toilet paper instead of the ruff commercial kind you usually get. Jackie even offers wine and snacks in the main house on Fridays and Saturdays where you can stay and enjoy or go to the main porch and sit. Unlike some B&B's where the owners are always in your face, Jackie is there to help make your stay as memorable as possible but not to bother you. As she says, 'If you need me for anything just call my cell and I'll be there.' The location is also great. It is away from the hustle of tourists so it's very quiet but just a short walk to everything. We highly recommend this place if you are planning a trip to Savannah. We will definitely stay there again when we go back.
reviews.title: Fantastic Place

likes.liked: — the friendliness of the innkeeper and all the extra touches she adds to make you stay pleasurable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I enjoyed a delightful 5 nights at the Zeigler House Inn in March 2008. Our hostess Jackie lived up to all the glowing reports on TripAdvisor. She was warm, welcoming, and able to provide excellent advice on restaurants, museums, and tours in Savannah.
reviews.title: Wonderful, relaxing stay at the Zeigler House!

likes.liked: — Clean, comfortable, BEAUTIFUL accommodations and first class innkeeper

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed first in the Lafayette rooms and then in the Giverny Suite (we had to switch rooms as we made last minute reservations during a very busy time), and in each case the rooms were immaculate and the linens of fine quality. The Giverny, which is on the top floor has more light and space, but both rooms are beautifully appointed and provided us with comfort and serenity.
reviews.title: An outstanding weekend/valentine's day/babymoon

likes.liked: — Spacious room, great food and great host!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved Savannah, finding that we could walk to anywhere in the Historic District; so we did not bother to rent a car. We inadvertently booked during the St. Patrick's Day celebration weekend which meant there were lots of inebriated revelers in the streets during the night after the parade. As we learned, hundreds of thousands of people flock to Savannah for the parade.
reviews.title: Great Experience!

likes.disliked: — The Maid was a bit rude

reviews.text: We did watch some of the parade and enjoyed what we saw, but if you are not looking to be part of that scene, I would recommend a different weekend. One additional plus of the Zeigler House was that it is a ways from the lively bar scene along River Street -- which appeared to be Spring Break Central. And, Zeigler House is just steps away from the Wilkes Boarding House restaurant and a few blocks from Mercer House.
reviews.title: Wonderful time, wonderful experience, and wonderful B&B.
Fun times!
reviews.text: We have just returned from a fabulous trip to Savannah - 4 couples. This B&B is one of the nicest we have ever stayed in...the morning bakery goods were delicious, the rooms were beautiful, and the Innkeeper Jackie is a doll. The refridgerator is stocked with water, sodas, jucies, yogurt, and many other things for you to indulge in...and there was even packages of snacks for your afternoon munchies. Jackie was always there to help with any questions we had. We all felt very comfortable using any part of the house. Our breakfast was eaten on our connecting verandas and in the afternoon we had wine on the upstaris veranda.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This Inn is so centrally located that you can walk anywhere in the historical district. But if you do have a car there is even a small parking lot behind the Inn for your convenience. We all give this Inn a 10 a definite must do!
reviews.title: Better Than We Hoped For

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I spent our 10-year anniversary at the Zeigler House Inn 3/29 - 4/1. For us, it was the perfect choice. The Inn is located on scenic and quiet Jones Streeet, near the southern end of the historic district yet easily within walking distance of the river.
reviews.title: sets a new standard

reviews.text: The rooms are extravagant. We stayed in the Giverny suite (I saw an earlier post that described the bed as a "sleep machine", and I cannot find words any more accurate). It was a difficult decision to leave the room each morning.
reviews.title: Wonderful Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: With all of the fresh baked goods provided (and stocked kitchen), we had big breakfasts, skipped lunch, and ate out for dinner.
reviews.title: Our honeymoon, and anniversaries will be there for sure.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just returned from spending our Honeymoon at The Ziegler House. We could not have been happier with our choice of accommodations. Everything was perfect! The whole house and especially the Giverny Suite was so beautiful and comfortable, it truly was a "home away from home" (only better). The fresh baked goodies everyday were a real treat; we loved the convenience of having breakfast daily without having to leave the privacy of our room. This is a wonderful alternative to a traditional B&B, especially for a romantic getaway. Jackie is a wonderful host; she was very accommodating in having our room ready for early check-in on the day of our wedding (that was a huge help). I cannot wait to go back, I am already planning for our one-year anniversary.
reviews.title: Everything was Perfect

likes.liked: — Location; fresh baked goods; wonderful host

reviews.text: three of us came for a little get away vacation and I'm the hero because I booked the Zeigler House Inn. My friends and I loved the suites we had. Jackie is so gratious and caring. She really went out of her way even to the point of digging up chairs and a blanket for a concert in the park. She bakes fabulous fresh pastries every day. The rooms are all beautifully decorated, charming and warm. The location in the Historic District is perfect, we could walk to everything. Prices are also VERY reasonable. We'd stay here again in a heartbeat and all of us will recommend to anyone going to Savannah. Make your reservations today, you won't be disappointed!
reviews.title: Fabulous B & B

reviews.text: Laura W
reviews.title: One of my favorite places on the planet.
More like being at "home".
reviews.text: Houston Texas

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the minute Jackie greeted me at the front door to the moment I hugged her goodbye 8 days later (and I’ve NEVER hugged a B&B owner in my life before that day!!) Zeigler House felt like home to me.
reviews.title: Excellent!

likes.liked: — The most comfortable bed I have ever slept in.
likes.disliked: — Nothing. Honestly. Loved every aspect of it.

reviews.title: The best!!!
reviews.text: We spent 3 nites - June 21 to 24 here based on all the excellent reviews and couldn't have been happier! Jackie is very friendly and helpful and a wonderful baker! We couldn't eat all that she made for us but what we did was fantastic, and more than held us over for a late lunch/early dinner.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in the Provence room and loved the decor and the adorable, cool, private patio.
reviews.title: Simply Perfect!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Jackie is a wonderful hostess and the extra touches she provides shows how much she loves what she does.
reviews.title: Peaceful pampering in Savannah

likes.disliked: — Water pressure a little low in shower/bath

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We would stay again in a heartbeat!
reviews.title: If you want to be spoiled

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Ziegler House is the is simply perfect! A must visit!
reviews.title: What a gem!

likes.liked: — Freedom to come & go as desired, accessibility of local attractions

description: Top value and extraordinary comforts of Savannah’s privileged gentlefolk are enjoyed at Zeigler House Inn, a stately lumber-magnate's mansion turned top-tier mini-hotel / B&B. Magnificently placed along legendary Jones Street in the Savannah historic district, room rates include Jackie's (daily) mini la pastisserie magasin [Pastry Shop] style dessert bar, in-room breakfast (perhaps in bed, featuring sweet and savory breakfasts, fruit, yogurt), plus snacks, beverages & parking. Add pre-dinner appetizers Friday and Saturday only. Unique tour packages and ultimate privacy are the hallmarks! Seven (7) extraordinarily roomy accommodations, each with full- or mini-kitchen, feature plush custom beds, al fresco spaces, and whirlpool baths. Golfer & caterer-turned-innkeeper Jackie Heinz fascinates guys, gals, and couples with a triple experience – sultry Savannah’s southern / generous hospitality and beautiful backdrop, curated French-themed sleep retreats and French pastries, plus more European (German and Austrian) heritage. Jackie will share recipes and invites the media.
